claims.node_value:
3,3-Diphenylpropylamines of the general formula



wherein:
R1 is hydrogen and R2 is C1-C6 alkylcarbonyl; or
R1 is C1-C6 alkylcarbonyl and R2 is hydrogen;
their salts with physiologically acceptable acids, their free bases and, when the 3,3-Diphenylpropylamines are in the form of optical isomers, the racemic mixture and the individual enantiomers.
The 3,3-Diphenylpropylamine of claim 28 wherein R1 is hydrogen and R2 is C1-C6 alkylcarbonyl.
The 3,3-Diphenylpropylamine of claim 28 wherein R1 is C1-C6 alkylcarbonyl and R2 is hydrogen.

A method of treating urinary incontinence in a patient in need thereof, the method comprising administering to the patient an effective amount of a 3,3-Diphenylpropylamine of the general formula



wherein:
R1 is hydrogen and R2 is C1-C6 alkylcarbonyl; or
R1 is C1-C6 alkylcarbonyl and R2 is hydrogen;
or its salt with a physiologically acceptable acid, its free base or, when the 3,3-Diphenylpropylamine is in the form of optical isomers, the racemic mixture and the individual enantiomers.
The method of claim 31 wherein R1 is hydrogen and R2 is C1-C6 alkylcarbonyl.
The method of claim 31 wherein R1 is C1-C6 alkylcarbonyl and R2 is hydrogen.

The method according to any one of claims 31-33, wherein the 3,3-Diphenylpropylamine is administered to the patient in the form of a pharmaceutical composition comprising a pharmaceutically acceptable carrier.
A pharmaceutical composition comprising an effective amount of a 3,3-Diphenylpropylamine according to any one of claims 28-30 and a pharmaceutically acceptable carrier.
